contentrichtext.text: {{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalSport | Men's [[Athletics (sport)|athletics]]}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Olympic Games]]}} {{MedalGold | [[1988 Summer Olympics|1988 Seoul]] | [[Athletics at the 1988 Summer Olympics|4x100 m relay]]}} {{MedalCompetition|[[IAAF World Championships in Athletics|World Championships]]}} {{MedalSilver | [[1987 World Championships in Athletics|1987 Rome]] | 4x100 m relay}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Vladimir Valentinovich Krylov''' ({{lang-ru|Влади́мир Валенти́нович Крыло́в}}) (born 26 February 1964) is a former [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[athletics (sport)|athlete]]. He was Soviet 100, 200 and 400 metres champion, and also Soviet indoor 200 metres in 1989. He was the winner of gold medal in 4x100 m [[relay race|relay]] at the [[1988 Summer Olympics]]. A year later he was first in the European cup sprint relay, as well as third in the 100 metres. Born in [[Sengiley]], [[Sengileyevsky District]], [[Ulyanovsk Oblast]], Krylov trained at [[Dynamo (sports society)|Dynamo]] in [[Ulyanovsk]]. He finished fifth in 400 m at the 1985 [[IAAF World Cup]]. In the next year, at the [[1986 European Championships in Athletics#Track|1986 European Championships]], Krylov surprisingly won the 200 m and was third in 4x400 m relay. At the [[1987 World Championships in Athletics|1987 World Championships]], he finished fifth in 200 m and was a member of Soviet 4x100 m relay team, which won the silver medal. At the [[Seoul]] [[Olympic Games|Olympics]], Krylov reached the semifinals of 100 m, but did not start there. He was also a member of the Soviet 4x100 m relay team, which won the gold medal. Krylov made his final start at the international championships at the [[1990 European Championships in Athletics|1990 European Championships]], where he finished seventh in 100 m. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{iaaf name|id=1526|name=Vladimir Krylov}} *[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/kr/vladimir-krylov-1.html Sports Reference] {{Footer Olympic Champions 4x100 m Men|1988}} {{Footer European Champions 200 m Men}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Krylov, Vladimir | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = [[Athletics (sport)]] competitor | DATE OF BIRTH = 26 February 1964 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Krylov, Vladimir}} [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Russian sprinters]] [[Category:Soviet sprinters]] [[Category:Olympic athletes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Dynamo sports society athletes]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1988 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic gold medalists for the Soviet Union]] [[Category:People from Ulyanovsk Oblast]] [[Category:Olympic medalists in athletics (track and field)]] [[Category:World Championships in Athletics medalists]] [[Category:European Athletics Championships medalists]]
